comment.author: 7613288@N05
comment._content: Not just any football team: this one had Watty Moore, Jack Cameron, George Luke and Ken Johnson in it. It may be the 1956-57 vintage that almost beat Manchester United.

comment.author: 7613288@N05
comment._content:
"Central Park" from Pools fanzine "Monkey Business" gives the following definitive line up:
From the left:
 
Jackie Newton
George Luke
Bobby Lumley
Ray Thompson
Watty Moore
Ken Johnson
Tommy McGuigan
Jack Cameron
Man in goal keeper's jersey  unknown
Ned Westgarth trainer (son of Fred)
 
Extreme left behind Jackie Newton, judging from the hair line I would say that it is probably Frank Stamper
Three quarter face behind Bobby Lumley is Jim Dyson (goal keeper).  Is now fitness coach at Mowden Park RFC

comment.author: 47908901@N03
comment._content: Thank you pillager for adding to our collections knowledge, most appreciated!

comment.author: 64768623@N08
comment._content: Great memories for me seeing this photo. I remember the team very well and was a ball boy at the Victoria Ground in my youth.

comment.author: 12579202@N04
comment._content: Not 100% certain but the chap 2nd from the right could be Fred Richardson, Bears a striking resemblance. Still going strong is Fred.
